html: 9.21.18  12:26 am   I've been trying to get into content creation vaguely similar to your style for a while, every time you make a new song it simultaneously encourages and discourages me, because I know it'll be a long time before I'm even as good as your 2010 days, and here you are pumping out songs every 2 weeks. This isn't really a question so I guess, why are you so good at consistently rising above expectations?

But in a good way?

9.20.18  7:15 pm   does MSHiatBU change time signatures at any point? maybe i wasn't paying attention but it seemed like it was in 4/4 the whole time.

     maybe people mean to say that some parts are syncopated ? like at 1:07, the rhythm just gets a little weird when you are talking about the people leaving your office cause you havent been paying them much anymore.

      i'm thinking people are also talking about 1:18 and 1:47 when the rhythm changes a little but i think it still stays in 4/4
9.20.18  7:02 pm   Will you ever make a music video for 'got to know what's going on'? It's a very good song btw
9.20.18  6:59 pm   What made you want to start making this awesome music?

9.20.18  6:37 pm   Hey Bill, I've been reading through the past week or so of questions and answers and I have noticed a trend in how you answer questions, and I assume it is completely intentional and an extension of the persona that you display in your songs, which in itself is cool and honestly pretty damn endearing due to the sideways and sometimes really succinct and brief ways you answer most complex questions/comments that I or most other people would elaborate upon.

      My guess for why you rarely elaborate on any answer you give (especially in regards to questions about you or your music) is because you either want people to figure it out for themselves or its just personal and (I assume) you don't want to divulge that information about yourself, both of which are respectable and genuine reasons. However as someone who just wants to know whats going on inside that brilliant brain of yours, it drives me absolutely insane! You so very clearly have ideas you want to convey a nd messages you want to communicate with everyone, and about 80% of these questions have genuine answers about motivation, attitude and inspiration, all of which are actually GREAT advice! If possible could you give an explanation of a lot of the motivation behind your songs?

      or at least in some way tell us a message or central idea you want your audience to take away from your music.

      And don't worry, i'm not expecting a direct answer, both because you're not a very direct person in your responses most of the time, and more so because all great teachers of philosophy and introspective thought never just tell people what they are trying to get them to understand.

      I really really want a full response so I can understand your thought process. To be more clear, i'm not asking for a "moral of the story" message or anything like that, I'm asking more if there is a method of thought that you live by that leaks through in your songs? Because you have a very unique way of making song s that a lways seems to have deep and intertwining themes. If possible can you walk us through your philosophical approach to the world around you and your attitude towards trials in life as well as your way of expressing this through your music?

     Don't worry, i'm already expecting on getting goofed on with a one word response, or getting a really backwards answer. I just figured that I might as well try and ask all this stuff. Because after all, where is the harm in asking.

9.20.18  9:01 am   hey so you were wondering if the gift shop of mt. st. helens is still "there" but I'm curious if you thought the chord on "there" was too regular as just a little 2 5,

      since the picture being painted is kind of distant and longing, where as the chord is very straightforward feeling. Though at the same time i understand your choice within the context of the piece and the time limit. curious if you have any tidbits

9.20.18  8:12 am   As far as I can recall, none of your songs have had a fading outro vamp before "Mount St. Helens is about to Blow Up".

      Was this just a particular stylistic choice for this song,

      or was it done in the interest of saving time due to your extremely tight production schedule?

9.20.18  3:37 am   Hey Bill, I just missed the opportunity to go to a music school in New York and instead went to a local college as a non-music major. Do you have any advice for me?

      I feel like I will regret my decision for the rest of my life because I wasn't brave enough to take the challenge/risk of going to school there.

      I love your work!
